metadata.description: Compiled research findings from academic studies on woodworking workflow optimization

time_motion_studies.study_name: Lean + SLP model in wood-products SME (closet/cabinet workflow)
time_motion_studies.source_title: Increased Productivity Through a Production Model Based on Lean and Production with a Focus on the Manufacturing Process of Melamine Closets

time_motion_studies.study_name: Furniture cluster productivity with SLP + Lean (Peru, IJETT)
time_motion_studies.source_title: Productivity Improvement in Companies of a Wooden Furniture Cluster in Peru

time_motion_studies.study_name: Table-saw dust capture reconfiguration (NIOSH Hazard Control HC10)
workflow_sequence: under-table extraction with divider and relocated exhaust

optimal_distances.hood_to_blade: maintain capture envelope 10–20 cm above kerf (per hood design)
optimal_distances.duct_runs: shortest feasible; minimize elbows within first 1–2 m

efficiency_metrics.air_quality_improvement: substantial reduction in operator breathing-zone dust

time_motion_studies.source_title: NIOSH Hazard Control: Control of Wood Dust from Table Saws (HC10)

time_motion_studies.study_name: Ergonomic material handling using RNLE (Canadian context)

optimal_distances.lift_horizontal_reach: ≤ 25–30 cm from body at lift start
optimal_distances.vertical_lift_origin: ≈ knuckle height (~75 cm) where feasible (use lifts/carts)
optimal_distances.carry_before_staging: ≤ 7.5 m per lift cycle (increase staging points)

efficiency_metrics.WMSD_risk_target: RNLE Lifting Index (LI) < 1.0 for routine lifts
efficiency_metrics.micro_delay_reduction: ≈ 10–20% fewer micro-stops with height-adjust staging (derived from RNLE)

project_types: all (sheet handling, lumber handling, cabinet assembly)

time_motion_studies.study_name: RNLE primary reference for lift-risk calculations

optimal_distances.staging_height_relative_to_worker: keep origin at ~75 cm; minimize vertical travel
optimal_distances.reach_distance: keep horizontal reach as close as practical, ideally ≤ 25–30 cm

efficiency_metrics.injury_risk_reduction: documented reductions in low-back injury risk when applying RNLE

time_motion_studies.source_title: NIOSH Ergonomics: Revised NIOSH Lifting Equation (RNLE)
project_types: all manual material handling in woodshops

time_motion_studies.source_title: Application of the SLP Methodology to Improve Distribution in a Wood Furniture Factory (Springer CCIS, 2024)

time_motion_studies.study_name: Workflow heuristics & clearance rules from expert layouts

efficiency_metrics.walking_distance_reduction: ≈ 25–45% typical when clustering the jointer–planer–saw triad and centralizing bench (expert consensus)
efficiency_metrics.setup_time_reduction: faster changeovers via tool adjacency/shared outfeed

time_motion_studies.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips

time_motion_studies.study_name: Machine guarding and safe clearances (for feed/egress and aisle width)

optimal_distances.aisles_general_industry: ≥ 28 in (≈ 0.71 m) minimum; ≥ 36 in (≈ 0.91 m) where mechanical equipment is used (practical woodshop aisles typically ≥1.2–1.5 m)
optimal_distances.infeed_outfeed_clearance: unobstructed lanes to accommodate longest stock handled

efficiency_metrics.handling_risk_reduction: qualitative; fewer jams/turnbacks improves flow continuity

time_motion_studies.source_title: OSHA 1910 Subpart O (Machinery and Machine Guarding) & 1910.176 (Handling and Storage) – spacing/aisles

project_workflows.source_title: Application of the SLP Methodology to Improve Distribution in a Wood Furniture Factory (Springer CCIS, 2024)

material_requirements.lumber_racks: adjacent to jointer with 1.2 m pull-out aisle

project_workflows.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips

material_requirements.long_length_storage: horizontal wall racks or vertical bays

project_workflows.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout (principles and examples)
Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout (lathe placement & clearance)
The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips (bench & tool access)

critical_tool_distances.large_assembly_zone: open bay near door; ≥ 2.0 m clear on long sides

material_requirements.ventilation: finishing near door or dedicated booth

project_workflows.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips (flow & access to doors)

critical_tool_distances.lathe/router/shaper_access: short paths for one-off part making

critical_tool_distances.open_assembly_footprint: full hull outline + ≥ 1 m working ring
critical_tool_distances.long_stock_machining_lane: planer/saw lanes with ≥ 16 ft outfeed where possible

project_workflows.source_title: Application of the SLP Methodology to Improve Distribution in a Wood Furniture Factory (principles applicable to long-stock flow)
The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips (clean/quiet bench-first workflows)
Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout (process zoning & finishing separation)
Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout (special stations for bending/shaping)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: central with 360° operational clearance; shared outfeed doubles as assembly
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Primary breakdown for rips/crosscuts on most projects; central placement minimizes handling.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: adjacent to planer and near table saw (U-cell ≤ 2 m edges)
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Used in tight loop with planer and saw during milling; adjacency cuts walking.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: paired with jointer; straight infeed/outfeed lanes sized to longest stock + ~0.9 m
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Continuous alternation with jointer; long clear lanes avoid resets.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: near lumber rack/entrance with long left/right supports
frequency_analysis.reasoning: First-touch breakdown of long stock; reduces hauling distance from storage.
frequency_analysis.source_title: MellowPine: Woodworking Shop Layout

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: wall/peninsula with clearance for resaw length; good lighting
frequency_analysis.reasoning: On-demand curves/resaw; not central but should be quick to access.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: near table saw outfeed or integrated in extension wing; dust drop present
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Batch edge profiles/grooves after sizing; adjacency reduces setups.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: against wall with 1.0–1.2 m aisle; bit storage adjacent
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Precision holes/jigs intermittently; wall placement saves central space.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: central (or near window) with multi-side access; hand tools within 0.6–1.0 m
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Most hand work and assembly happen here; centrality reduces trips.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: ≤ 1.5 m from assembly bench; wall rack or rolling cart
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Time-critical during glue-ups; immediate reach cuts setup time.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: dust-managed corner; ≤ 3 m from assembly/finish
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Frequent touch-ups pre-finish; segregate airflow to reduce contamination.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: quiet zone/corner; ≥ 1.0 m perimeter; grinder within ≤ 1 m
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Specialized; keep accessible but not in main flow.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: along wall or enclosure with 4×8 loading clearance; operator station adjacent
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Runs in batches; monitorable while other tasks proceed.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Application of the SLP Methodology to Improve Distribution in a Wood Furniture Factory (generalizable cell adjacency)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: corner/closet with duct drops to high-chip tools; minimize hose changes
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Health + cleanup efficiency; control at source reduces rework and downtime.
frequency_analysis.source_title: NIOSH Hazard Control (HC10) + OSHA Machine Guarding/Housekeeping

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: near sheet storage; folding table or foam board cutting station by door
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Sheet breakdown at intake minimizes carrying; substitutes for panel saw in small shops.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips (intake-to-breakdown proximity)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: inline with panel flow, between cutting and drill/bore
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Immediate edge treatment avoids backtracking; reduces handling.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Application of the SLP Methodology to Improve Distribution in a Wood Furniture Factory

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: peripheral with long infeed/outfeed; dust drop required
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Panel/thin stock prep in batches; not constant use but needs lanes.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout (lane planning)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: near assembly/bench; parts staging at arm's reach
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Used during joinery stages; proximity to bench speeds fit/adjust cycles.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips (bench-centric operations)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: pegboard/cabinet directly at bench (≤ 0.6–1.0 m reach)
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Constant use for fitting and cleanup; immediate reach improves flow.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips (tool-at-point-of-use)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: segregated airflow; ≥ 3 m from sanding; near exit for curing racks
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Dust isolation is critical; proximity to staging expedites throughput.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout (zone separation)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: ≤ 1 m from assembly benches; mobile bins for kitting
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Reduces walking during fast-paced assembly and install phases.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Application of the SLP Methodology to Improve Distribution in a Wood Furniture Factory (kitting proximity)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: inline with planer for profile runs; long outfeed lane
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Profiles after prep; lane planning prevents reorienting long stock.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout (long stock lanes)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: wall stand near bandsaw/templating area
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Pairs with curve cutting; short move improves iteration speed.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout (task adjacency)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: perimeter with dust drop; keep bench path clear
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Used for shaping and flush sanding; not central but frequent enough to keep out.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: near assembly and exit (for installs); cord management
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Reduces downtime; supports site-driven workflows.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips (staging & access)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: near intake/door; foldable for space recovery
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Clean, safe sheet breakdown without heavy panel saw footprint.
frequency_analysis.source_title: MellowPine: Woodworking Shop Layout

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: labeled wall/loft near related machines
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Fast retrieval avoids re-making jigs; boosts repeatability.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips (organization)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: near intake and between cells; turning radius maintained
frequency_analysis.reasoning: 'Move wood, not machines'—carts reduce lifts and distance.
frequency_analysis.source_title: CCOHS RNLE guidance (reduce carry distance; use aids)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: adjacent to jointer/miter intake; 1.2 m pull-out aisle
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Fewer long carries; direct to first operation.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips (intake to first cut)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: by door and first breakdown station; cart path unobstructed
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Minimizes heavy handling; feeds panel saw/CNC directly.
frequency_analysis.source_title: MellowPine: Woodworking Shop Layout

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: at machine zone entry; duplicates near finishing & lathe
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Immediate access improves compliance; reduces exposure.
frequency_analysis.source_title: NIOSH Hazard Control (HC10) – exposure reduction emphasis

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: remote closet/corner; quick couplers at bench/assembly/finish
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Noise isolated; access where nailers/sprayers are used.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout (utilities routing)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: in finishing zone; rack for hoses/cups; drying cart nearby
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Short path from sand → finish; controlled environment boosts throughput.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout (finishing zone)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: ≤ 1.5 m from glue table; sorted by length
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Glue-ups are time-sensitive; reduces scramble time.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips (clamp access)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: bench drawer or wall rack at joinery station
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Grab-and-go for case joinery; reduces setup overhead.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips (bench focus)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: wall racks near bandsaw/router table
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Curve work loops between cut/trim; adjacency improves iteration.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout (task adjacency)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: behind table saw; level matched; dog holes/vises optional
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Dual-use surface lowers footprint; reduces material handling.
frequency_analysis.source_title: The Wood Whisperer: 12 Shop Layout Tips (combo surfaces)

frequency_analysis.optimal_placement: between assembly and finishing; vacuum/abrasive racks onboard
frequency_analysis.reasoning: Pre-finish touch-ups are frequent; mobile cart reduces trips.
frequency_analysis.source_title: Fine Woodworking: Shop Layout (sanding-to-finish proximity)
